intro: Delissea grimesiana var. obatae, commonly known as the Obatae's Delissea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a fragrant scent, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
